result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Toran requests a Trial date.
The Court will set a Trial date and will also schedule a plea/sentencing date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 10:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

State has complied with victim's rights. Victims are in the gallery.

Defense has received discovery and requests one further proceeding to negotiate with the State.

Hearing on April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:32 AM Defendant Jayvon M Boyd in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A's family listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:22 AM Defendant Jayvon M Boyd in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
